newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's Feb agricultural import prices up - AFTAK.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's Feb agricultural import prices up - AFTAK.

text.p: South Korea's agricultural commodities import prices rose slightly in February from the previous month on gains in world markets, the Association of Foreign Trading Agents of Korea (AFTAK) said on Monday.
AFTAK was established in 1970 with the approval of the South Korean government and currently has 13,200 members representing more than 45,000 overseas suppliers, an AFTAK official said.
Its member firms handle over 82 percent of the country's total imports, he added.

The official said AFTAK's main activities include the declaration and approval of offer-issuing business, liason and coordination with the government authorities concerned on behalf of the membership.
Import prices for agricultural commodities are as follows:
